template<typename T = GenomicRegion>
const T& SnowTools::GenomicRegionCollection< T >::at ( size_t  i  )  const

Retrieve a GenomicRegion at given index.

Note that this does not move the idx iterator, which is used to loop through all the regions. Throws an exception if the index is out of bounds.

Returns:
GenomicRegion pointed to by index i

template<typename T = GenomicRegion>
void SnowTools::GenomicRegionCollection< T >::createTreeMap (  ) 

Fill in the GenomicIntervalTreeMap stored in this object.

A GenomicIntervalTreeMap is an unordered_map of GenomicIntervalTrees for each chromosome. A GenomicIntervalTree is an interval tree on the ranges defined by the genomic interval, with cargo set at the same GenomicRegion object.

Referenced by SnowTools::GenomicRegionCollection< GenomicRegion >::add().

Read in a MuTect call-stats file and adds to GenomicRegionCollection object.

Reads a MuTect call-stats file and imports only lines with KEEP marked.

template<typename T = GenomicRegion>
void SnowTools::GenomicRegionCollection< T >::regionFileToGRV ( const std::string &  file,
int  pad = 0 
)

Read in a text file (can be gzipped) and add to GenomicRegionCollection

This function will automatically detect which file type is being input: -- ends in .vcf -> readVCFfile -- ends in .bed -> readBEDfile -- header contains "MuTect" -> readMuTect The values are appended to existing vector of GenomicRegion objects

Parameters:
file Text file to read and store intervals
pad Amount to pad the intervals by (calls GenomicRegion::pad)

Rewind the element pointer to the first GenomicRegion

template<typename T = GenomicRegion>
string SnowTools::GenomicRegionCollection< T >::sendToBED (  )  const

Output the GenomicRegionCollection to a BED format

Currently just outputs chr pos pos2 with no header.

Returns:
BED formated string reprsentation
